newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Asia Securities mulls China spinoff.
newsitem.headline: Asia Securities mulls China spinoff.

text.p: Asia Securities International Ltd said on Tuesday it is studying the feasibility of spinning off its China business as a separate listing.

"The company is presently exploring the feasibility of spinning off its PRC's (People's Republic of China) business for separate listing which is still in a preliminary stage," the company said in a statement.
It gave no details on the spinoff business in China.

"The company is presently negotiating with a company under the administration of the Ministry of Foreign Trade and Economic Cooperation in relation to the injection of capital into the company which is also in a preliminary stage," it said.
Asia Securities said "the proposed transactions are at a very preliminary stage and may or may not proceed".

Asia Securities said it made the statement in response to reports that a company under the administration of the Ministry of Foreign Trade and Economic Cooperatiion was proposing to inject capital into the company and that the company was planning to spin off its China business for separate listing.
Asia Securities shares were up HK$0.50 to HK$2.25 in early afternoon trade on Tuesday on volume of 74.04 million shares.
